skill.name: clinical-decision-support
skill.description: Generate professional clinical decision support (CDS) documents for pharmaceutical and clinical research settings, including patient cohort analyses (biomarker-stratified with outcomes) and treatment recommendation reports (evidence-based guidelines with decision algorithms). Supports GRADE evidence grading, statistical analysis (hazard ratios, survival curves, waterfall plots), biomarker integration, and regulatory compliance. Outputs publication-ready LaTeX/PDF format optimized for drug development, clinical research, and evidence synthesis.
skill.summary: Generate professional clinical decision support (CDS) documents for pharmaceutical and clinical rese...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: The skill consists of local Python scripts and document templates with no network access or external command execution. It reads user-supplied files and writes local outputs, which is low risk when used with intended inputs and output paths.

low_findings.title: Reads user-supplied local files
low_findings.description: The scripts load input files from user-provided paths, for example `df = pd.read_csv(filepath)` and `with open(json_file, 'r') as f:`. If a user points to sensitive files, their contents are processed and could appear in outputs.

low_findings.title: Writes reports to local filesystem
low_findings.description: The scripts write CSV, TXT, and TeX outputs such as `df_table.to_csv(output_file, index=False)` and `with open(output_dir / f'{prefix}_statistics.txt', 'w') as f:`. Misconfigured output paths could overwrite files.

content.value_statement: Clinical teams need consistent evidence summaries and cohort analyses. This skill produces structured CDS documents with tables, survival curves, and decision algorithms.
actual_capabilities: Generate baseline, efficacy, and safety cohort tables in CSV and LaTeX
Classify PD-L1 and HER2 biomarkers and output stratification reports
Build TikZ clinical decision algorithms from JSON or text
Produce Kaplan-Meier curves with log-rank tests and hazard ratios
Validate CDS documents for sections, citations, and HIPAA identifiers
limitations: Requires a local Python environment with pandas, scipy, lifelines, and matplotlib
Does not fetch external guidelines or literature sources
Does not compile full LaTeX documents into PDFs
Not intended for individual patient treatment decisions

use_cases.title: Cohort outcome reporting
use_cases.description: Create biomarker-stratified baseline, efficacy, and safety tables for study reports.

use_cases.title: Guideline draft support
use_cases.description: Assemble recommendation documents with evidence grading and decision pathways.

use_cases.title: Survival analysis package
use_cases.description: Generate Kaplan-Meier plots, hazard ratios, and risk tables for presentations.

prompt_templates.title: Cohort tables starter
prompt_templates.scenario: You have a cohort CSV with group labels
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate baseline, efficacy, and safety tables from cohort.csv and save outputs to tables/.

prompt_templates.title: Biomarker classification
prompt_templates.scenario: You need PD-L1 and HER2 stratification
prompt_templates.prompt: Classify pd_l1_tps and her2_ihc in biomarkers.csv, then save a stratification report to stratification/.

prompt_templates.title: Survival analysis run
prompt_templates.scenario: You need Kaplan-Meier curves and stats
prompt_templates.prompt: Run survival analysis on survival_data.csv and write plots and statistics to survival_output/.

prompt_templates.title: Algorithm flowchart
prompt_templates.scenario: You want a TikZ decision tree from JSON
prompt_templates.prompt: Convert algorithm_spec.json into a TikZ flowchart and save it as clinical_algorithm.tex.

output_examples.input: Create a cohort table and survival summary for a biomarker-positive group.
output: Baseline and efficacy tables saved as CSV and LaTeX
Kaplan-Meier plot generated with log-rank p-value
Risk table and statistical summary written to the output folder

best_practices: Use de-identified cohort data with consistent column names
Review generated recommendations for clinical validity and citations
Set a dedicated output directory to avoid overwriting files
anti_patterns: Using the skill for individual patient treatment plans
Providing incomplete CSV columns for required analyses
Assuming LaTeX outputs are already compiled to PDF

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it is designed for those platforms and uses local scripts and templates.

faq.question: What are the data limits?
faq.answer: Limits depend on your local Python environment and available memory.

faq.question: Can it integrate with other tools?
faq.answer: You can pipe outputs into LaTeX or analytics pipelines, but no direct API integrations exist.

faq.question: How is data safety handled?
faq.answer: All processing is local; the scripts do not make network calls.

faq.question: What should I do if a script fails?
faq.answer: Check required Python packages, input column names, and output paths.

faq.question: How does it compare to a general document writer?
faq.answer: It is specialized for clinical cohort analysis, grading, and LaTeX-ready outputs.
